Then On we all go.

text:
Do NOT underestimate the impacts of a heatwave:

🚧 on roads and other transport networks
⚡️ on energy demand
🏥 on health facilities
❄️ on cooling costs
💵 on insurance 
🏭 on business disruption
✈️ on industries such as tourism. 
🐄 on crops and livestock 
🐠 on marine resources and aquaculture

text: 🌱I was asked today when to water native plants. If you’re on the west coast and wondering when to water in summer, the best time is when it feels like it might rain or it’s already raining. The worst time is in the middle of a heatwave—water before the heat comes or don’t do it at all.

Irish Weather: ‘So, it’s going to be hot.’
Me: ‘OK.’
IW: ‘Really hot. You won’t believe it’s like this in September.’
Me: ‘Understood.’
IW: ‘If you go out, it could burn ya.’
Me: ‘Right. Got it.’
IW: ‘A heatwave.’
Me: ‘OK.’
IW:
Me:
IW:
Me:
IW:

IW: ‘But it’ll still rain.’
Me: ‘Of course.’

Managed to get thermal curtains hung just as the heatwave started.

Overnight, with fans, I get my flat down to about 21-22 centigrade. Over the day, it gets to about 24-25. Daytime max is about 29-30.

Thermal curtains, not just for winter.

text:
July heatwave last year: up at 4:30am, 15°C - every window and door wide open.
Almost unbelievable - had to shut them all at 7:00 as the thermometer raced into the 20's.
Closed the curtains too, even hung extra blackout material on sunward windows. 
Extreme?
Well, it worked.
Nice cool house.

There’s a heatwave coming and I am angry.

I want the cozy cold. 

I want the leaves to fall into their forever slumber. 

I want the smell of sharpened winds of wicked nights.

I want all things spooky, crackling, hooded, and autumnal.

text:
But the sudden extra heat comes with its own risks.

Yesterday at peak heat, a fire broke out in a settlement nearby destroying some 40 homes. Intense heat with low humidity makes fires more intense and dangerous.

Thankfully no lives were lost 🙏🏻  Devastating for the families nonetheless.

END/

text: 오늘도 heatwave는 계속 되고, 바다를 떠올릴 수 밖에 없었다. 창밖의 체온 보다 높은 공기가 여전히 노랗고 붉고, 오늘 떠올린 살갗에 닿는 바다의 느낌은 어제와 결코 같지 않다. 몹시 무력하고 몹시 화가 난다.
author: did:plc:r6ipi6ehilhwgmrjsh3kf6kd

text:
원래도 가물고 건조한 여름 중 유난히 온도가 오르는 날이 계속되면 대기질이 눈에 띄게 나빠진다. 올해는 여름 끝무렵에 최고 기온 40도에 육박하는 heatwave 가 닥쳤다. 덕분에 온통 노랗고 붉은 공기와 빛의 산란을 보았다. 모래먼지 이는 서부 영화 같은 빛, 이 무더위가 눈에 보인다면 이런 색일까 싶은 노랗고 붉은 창밖 풍경을 덧창으로 가리고 꼼짝없이 집에만 머물고 있다.

바다를 떠올린다. 하지만 시원한 해변에 닿으려면 30분을 땡볕 아래에 걸어야 하는 환경과, 어느 해변이든 자리 잡고 있는 많은 사람들 덕에 가진 않는다.

30°C (86°F) in the night, you cannot fall asleep even if you try your hardest.

Oh, it gets even better, you're supposed to wake up for work in 2 hours! With no sleep, everything hurts. I hate it so much...

text:
Fleas develop faster the hotter it gets. When we had a heatwave here in May, 6 months worth of fleas hit adulthood  all at once.

Today's heatwave update:
Today's high in Albuquerque was "only" 103° thanks to a random thunderstorm coming through the area around 5:00.

ABQ's normal average high temp in July is 91.8°, this month it's 98.9°.

text:
The body was rather ironically in the living room.

Six weeks of full heating, in the height of summer, with two weeks of heatwave had taken its toll. What remained was partially skeletonised, and wet.

So very wet.
author: did:plc:naikvcwkvuy2jlhqfdyrw2la

text: This poor little old lady had died alone in her flat... With the heating on full blast. And then the heatwave had come.

text:
The heatwave impacting Texas and the Southern U.S. is drawing renewed attention to occupational heat hazards. 

The Biden admin said almost 2 years ago that they want to develop a rule to protect workers; they have yet to propose one.
